review_title: Stable Place to Work with Lots of Opportunity
pros: There are some exceptional leaders here - leaders that value work/life balance, family, and career growth. Because the labor market is so small and it is harder to find talent, jobs with the company seem to be pretty stable. It is easy to network and move around the company to other opportunities.
cons: I've seen non-contributors remain with the company longer than they should because directors are hesitant to let people go.

review_title: Great Place to Start a Career

pros: I have had wonderful directors and clinical managers throughout the years. Benefits are fairly decent but have definitely gone downhill since I started in 2009.
cons: I have worked here for 13 years as an RN. The raises are insulting. The company finally gave raises across the board based on experience, but I was long overdue. I’ve known nurses who leave and come back and end up being offered higher pay than the nurses who have been within the organization for much longer.

review_title: Lack of coordination and organization on clinic level
pros: There are several hospitals, clinics, and specialties located in several locations in west TN.
cons: Huge lack of organization, coordination, meaningful training or resources for ongoing education within administrative positions within clinic settings (I don't know how it is in the hospitals - hopefully it's better organized). The organization seems so interested in expanding, that it puts acquiring of clinics ahead of planning out how they will be ran (horse is put before the cart in a lot of the undertakings that have affected my job). There isn't any consistency between the clinics as to how things are done.

review_title: Not a good company to work for

pros:
Decent medical, dental and vision insurance 
Good orientation program
cons:
Hurried to discharge patients quickly when they were not medically stable
Meetings upon meetings to discuss how to get the patients discharged as quickly as possible, but
If we would quit having 3 meeting per day, we could be working on the discharge plan
Used to be a good “family” organization… no more
Most directors are too focused on “climbing the ladder”‘to a prestigious position in administration
This organization has lost touch with their employees. Not just the nursing staff, but the medical staff as well. Hardly any of the long term hospitalists left….they have brought in locum tenems that couldn’t cause any less except for two that I know. Nursing staff cannot develop a good relationship with the medical staff because they hardly know them. By the time you learn who is who, they have gone to their next assignment.
WTH definitely stands for WTH if you know what I mean. 
No more bonuses, no raises for many of the departments…
No appreciation gifts for any of the departments when everyone is working their tails off.

pros: You have a job and maybe healthcare.
cons: The leadership is the worst I've run into in the 4 different health systems I've worked for. They are blatantly racist and homophobic, and will discriminate against you based on these factors and get away with it. If you are someone that is a minority or underrepresented group, I would honestly consider other options before subjecting yourself to this toxic work place. I know it's the only major employer in the area for healthcare, but you deserve better.

review_title: Old timers syndrome in full effect

job_title: Patient Access Representative in Jackson, TN
pros: There are a very select few kind people in the department. I can’t think of anything else positive.
cons: Literally everything else. I was expected to know things that I was never told (or told just once). An impossible amount of material and knowledge that they expect you to learn and do by yourself within a very short amount of time. The whole department has a very “cliquey” feel to it and most DEFINITELY favors those who have been there longer. If one of those few decide they don’t like you for no reason, forget it. You’ll be harassed and the blame will be turned on you regardless. The above reviews would have you believe that there is a family atmosphere, however, I overheard MANY of them degrading and putting down those same coworkers.

job_title: Medical Laboratory Technician in Jackson, TN
pros: I really enjoyed my job. There are also a lot of small events, where a department of the hospital will be selling BBQ or Tshirts or something. Each Christmas, employees get a gift (lunchbox, umbrella, wireless charger, etc)
cons: There are cliques and gossip like nowhere else. Harsh politics, and if you try to be nice to everyone and don’t join a group, you are treated significantly less like a person. It’s reminiscent of prison-gang culture.

review_title: I've v seen alot of changes over the past 20 years...some good but mostly not good if you work there
pros: Largest employer of Madison County.   You have options to try new areas as a nurse if you are unhappy where you are at.  We have some great nurses who truly care but are overworked due to short stafff.  Job security as a nurse. Finally got a raise this year! !  New nurses can obtain alot of experience.
cons: They have taken away alot of benefits and insurance cost went up also.  Administration is all about t  Always working short staff.  Very clicky place.   If they don’t like you...you will not have an easy time.  Favoritism is obvious.  The difficult patients that verbally abuse you!  I don't think the public understands how badly nurses are treated by patients and families...but that's all hospitals unfortunately.   When I leave I will not be coming back.   Oh and do not burn bridges with WTH as a nurse because you will be black balled in West Tennessee

pros: Hours, benefits, co-workers, job security

job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Jackson, TN
pros: Plenty of opportunities for jobs

job_title: Director of Marketing & Public Relations in Ripley, WV
pros: Incredibly friendly staff and administrators, who take the time to get to know their employees and genuinely care about you as a person. The health and well being of Jackson County residents are their top priority. I was free to do my job without being micromanaged, and when I needed advice or direction, there was an open-door policy with the CEO. The healthcare benefits were superb.
cons: Compared to other positions of this type in other markets, the pay may have been better. But the benefits, working conditions and attitude of my superiors and coworkers more than made up for this. Other than that, I could find no faults. I would most certainly recommend this hospital to my friends and family as a place to work AND receive quality healthcare.

review_title: It was good when I first came to the hospital, but as time passed I saw that it was more bad than good.
pros: Full time workers get health insurance and they are able to use their id badge to buy food in cafeteria  subway and chick a fil which comes out of your next upcoming check.
cons: It's a hospital so it's obvious that it is mostly busy all the time so there rarely are time to rest besides your break. Not all, but a lot of the employers are rude to other co workers and sometimes to the patients as well.

review_title: Low transparency within department and within WTH as a whole
job_title: Clinical Pharmacy Specialist in Jackson, TN
pros: Salary and benefits were in line with most regional companies. The company did have a pension plan for employees hired before ~2010.  PTO was generous while I was working there and increased every 7-8 years.
cons: Raises were not always given due to company performance and the 403B match was also taken away for several years then reintroduced at a lower rate.  The pension plan was taken away around 2010-2011 for new hires.  The PTO has recently reduced by half for all employees due to WTH's increased dept.  Promotions in my department were usually based upon personal rather than profession relationships.  Favoritism and nepotism were significant issues.

pros: Experience,  comparable  pay,  opportunity  to  improve and move up and forward,  patient  satisfaction  oriented
cons: Too  much  politics involved with employer/Management  relationship.  micro management  is  not for the future.  lack of feeling ssecure and knowing that your employer will have your back  even  with no reason

cons: I’m stuck making $10 a hour. I don’t get any benefits. I’ve been here for two years and haven’t had one paid day off.

pros: It's a great environment to work. Everybody's friendly and gets along very well. It's great for if you're a college student or a single parent they can't work full time hours.
